title: Tax Accountant
description:
Openings: 1
Location: Nairobi - TRM


Overview:
Taxes are more than numbers; they’re the bridge between compliance, cash efficiency, and strategic decisions. In this role, you’ll take ownership of VAT, WHT, PAYE, and ETR filings, ensuring that the company meets deadlines while minimizing unnecessary costs. Every return reconciled and every ledger checked is a step toward audit readiness and financial credibility.

Beyond routine compliance, you’ll dive into corporate tax estimates and year-end computations, spotting opportunities to optimize cash flows. Your work will feed directly into board reports and management decisions, making your accuracy and foresight critical.

Contracts and agreements cross your desk, and you’ll assess tax implications, flag risks, and advise on structuring that reduces exposure. This advisory lens keeps the finance team proactive rather than reactive and ensures that savings don’t slip through unnoticed.

Audits and regulatory correspondence are your stage to demonstrate control and clarity. Preparing defense files, answering queries, and maintaining meticulous records teaches both discipline and confidence when regulators come knocking.

If you enjoy precision, can translate complex rules into actionable guidance, and want a role that blends compliance, advisory, and strategy, this position offers high visibility, responsibility, and the chance to shape how the company navigates tax effectively.


Key Responsibilities:
- Compute & file VAT/WHT/PAYE/ETR; reconcile ledgers vs iTax.
- Prepare corporate tax estimates; support year-end computations.
- Maintain tax calendar, registers, and documentation.
- Review contracts for tax clauses; advise on risks and savings.
- Support tax audits and handle correspondence.

Education & Experience:
- BCom Accounting/Finance; CPA (K) preferred.
- 3–5 years tax specialization.

Skills & Tools:
- iTax mastery, Excel advanced, memo writing, attention to detail.

KPIs:
- On-time filings; assessment outcomes; penalties avoided.

Compensation (Kenya)
KES 160,000–260,000 + annual bonus.
Figures are estimates shared by our clients and vary with your experience, interview performance, certifications, and company pay bands.

Benefits:
- Medical, pension, CPD.

Growth Path (hierarchy/expected promotions):
- Senior Tax Accountant → Tax Manager → Head of Tax.
This is the ideal hierarchy inside the client’s company and thus the expected growth cycle for this position.

questions.prompt: Have you led VAT reconciliations end-to-end?
Have you handled a KRA tax audit?
Have you drafted tax advisory memos before?
Biggest tax risk you mitigated, what changed?
One complex iTax challenge you solved.

title: Accounts Payable (AP) Officer (4 positions)
description:

Overview:
Accounts Payable keeps the cash flowing and vendors happy, but it’s more than pushing buttons in a system. You’ll own invoice integrity from PO to GRN to payment, making sure every number matches and nothing slips through the cracks. Accuracy and timing are everything vendors notice, and errors cost.

You’ll partner with procurement and warehouse teams to resolve price or quantity discrepancies, learning how operational details ripple through the books. Each reconciliation, each payment run is a chance to see the bigger financial picture and understand controls in action.

The inbox never sleeps, and neither can your attention to SLA commitments. Early escalation of disputes and consistent follow-up separate good AP officers from great ones. You’ll track closures, maintain documentation, and keep everything auditable.

Month-end cycles bring pressure and learning. Accruals, schedules, and reporting teach rhythm, prioritization, and how accurate AP data drives management decisions. You’ll get hands-on exposure to ERP systems while mastering spreadsheet discipline.

If you like structured work that rewards meticulousness, enjoy vendor interactions, and want to see the tangible impact of accurate payments, this role gives immediate responsibility and visibility into corporate finance operations.

- Resolve price/quantity variances with Procurement/Warehouse.
- Prepare weekly pay runs; manage vendor ageing & reconciliations.
- Maintain supplier master data, WHT certificates, and tax compliance files.

Senior AP Officer → AP Supervisor → P2P Lead.

Numbers tell stories if you listen carefully. In this role, you’ll pull raw data from systems and Sheets, clean duplicates, and shape them into dashboards that the commercial team actually trusts. Accuracy isn’t optional; it’s your credibility currency.

Charts aren’t enough. Each dashboard needs a plain-English paragraph explaining what changed and why. Stakeholders should never guess your annotations guide decisions and prevent confusion. Curiosity and attention to detail uncover patterns others might miss.

Mentorship is part of the package. You’ll gradually level up with SQL queries or advanced Sheets techniques, learning to automate, reconcile, and visualize faster. Each new skill makes your insights sharper and your reports more impactful. Ad hoc questions and small investigations keep things lively. You’ll reconcile anomalies, maintain a clean data dictionary, and field stakeholder requests without losing your cool. The role blends routine with detective work: numbers rarely lie, but they sometimes need translation.

If you enjoy turning data into clear stories, spotting trends before anyone else, and making dashboards that actually guide decisions, this is your corner. Precision, curiosity, and clear communication will make you indispensable fast.

- Pull data from systems/Sheets; clean and reconcile.
- Build dashboards; publish on schedule with version notes.

- Field simple stakeholder requests and prioritize.

title: Market Research Analyst
